intro: Strobilanthes albostriata, commonly known as the white-striated makepeace, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and produces clusters of small, white flowers with prominent stamens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
